hypothesis_content.title: Post-Liquidity-Crash Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: Following the October liquidity crash, a sustained period of low volatility (BTC 20-day realized vol < 35%) in a NEUTRAL regime will resolve with a directional move exceeding 2.5x the recent ATR within 5 trading days after a volatility breakout signal.
hypothesis_content.rationale: The October liquidity crash created structural damage to market-making capacity. In neutral regimes, this manifests as suppressed volatility due to reduced participation. When participation returns or a catalyst emerges, the thin order books cause exaggerated moves as liquidity is sought.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day realized volatility < 35% for at least 10 consecutive days
BTC price within +/- 5% of 20-day moving average
Breakout: BTC closes > 2-day ATR above 20-day high (long) OR < 2-day ATR below 20-day low (short)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches entry +/- (2.5 * ATR at entry)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reverses to entry +/- (0.75 * ATR at entry)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 60% of such volatility compression periods in NEUTRAL regimes resolve with mean-reversion (price returns to 20-day MA) rather than sustained directional breakouts over a 100-day test period.
